content: Ilimex is a Northern Ireland–based biosecurity technology company that develops UVC-based air-sterilisation systems for agricultural environments. Our flagship product is Flufence™, which is designed to improve air cleanliness and support more consistent production cycles.

Ilimex works primarily in agricultural environments, conducting trials in sectors such as poultry and mushrooms. We collaborate with farmers, producers, universities, and research laboratories to improve biosecurity through our UVC-based air-sterilisation technology, Flufence™.

Flufence™ is a UVC-based air-sterilisation system designed for agricultural environments. It draws air through a sealed UVC chamber, exposes airborne microbes to UVC, and then returns treated air to the environment. Importantly, no UVC enters the room. The system is designed not to generate ozone and produces no chemical residues. Flufence complements existing ventilation and hygiene practices; it does not replace ventilation.
No, Flufence does not replace ventilation. It complements existing ventilation by treating the circulating air and enhancing environmental stability.

In the mushroom trial, Flufence™ was installed in House 18, while House 20 served as a control without Flufence. Observations showed that House 18 had more consistent yields and more stable environmental conditions across multiple cycles. Growers also reported finding it easier to maintain environmental targets in House 18. 

However, it’s important to note that these findings are based on observations from one site, and many factors can influence mushroom performance.
